de.thkoeln.bibl.api.lms.slnp.message

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.lms.slnp.message.Message
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RequestMessage, ResponseMessage

    public abstract class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    Class implements a generic abstract SLNP protocol message and methods to validate a message against protocol patterns. Sub-classes must define the specific SLNP message format with a REGEX describing a valid message and defining matching groups to extract message data from the raw message String. Example: ^(?<code>[0-9]{3})(?<name>.+)$
    Author:
    Patrick Rogalla

      Message(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.String pattern)
      Initialize a Message with a raw SLNP message and a pattern, which defines the message format with matching groups.

      • Message

        public Message(java.lang.String msg,
               java.lang.String pattern)
        throws java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException
        Initialize a Message with a raw SLNP message and a pattern, which defines the message format with matching groups.
        Parameters:
        msg - the raw SLNP server message
        pattern - the format as REGEX string
        Throws:
        java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - if the pattern's syntax is invalid

      • getMatch

        public java.lang.String getMatch(java.lang.String group)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the value from a matched group by group-name.
        Parameters:
        group - the name of the matching group
        Returns:
        the matched data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no capturing group in the pattern with the given name

      • getMatch

        public java.lang.String getMatch(int group)
                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the value from a matched group by group-index.
        Parameters:
        group - the index of the matching group
        Returns:
        the matched data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there is no capturing group in the pattern with the given index

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks the Message against the defined REGEX.
        Returns:
        true if the message is valid

      • parse

        public java.util.regex.Matcher parse()
                              throws MessageFormatException
        Parse the raw message string against the defined REGEX. After the message was parsed, the data is accessible with the getMatch() methods.
        Returns:
        a matcher for the parsed message
        Throws:
        MessageFormatException - if the raw message has a invalid format
